cab.content: The attached paraphrase of a telegram to thei - -Commander-in-Chief, Mediterranean, has been received from the Admiralty, and is circulated to the Cabinet for information..(Sgd) M.P..A. HANKEY".2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W.I., November 12th, 1920.F[HIS DOCIP1I NT 13 THfc PROPERTY OF HIS BKITANNIC MAJESTY1 S GOVERNMENT.copy 110.DOftFIIyl&TIAL. 3.P.2088.: C A B I h] K T.COMMERCIAL i'KAi)Br 1*1 to j&ACK SEA. Prom Admiralty -To Commander-in-Chief, Mediterranean,Paraphrase. Ho, 409 Z,November 11th, 1920.With regard to commercial trade in the Black Sea, the policy of His Majesty's Government is that4no.restrictions should be placed upon it. An exception would be made in any"case where there i as ground for suspicion that arms likely to be used for assisting trie forces of the "Turkish. Nationalists were carried by particular ships. You are requested to act in accord-ancn-. with this line of policy and to acknowledge receipt of this telegram.
